<i>noun</i><br><ol><li>adobe</li></ol>:
noun
  1. northsider (i.e. person from north side of the pueblo)

particle
  1. among the Mexicans (i.e. Taos city, Taos village)

noun
  1. (diminutive) mommy (used by very young children to mother)

noun
  1. mother, mother-in-law
  2. wife (used by husband when speaking to wife)
  3. mother (used by husband to refer to wife when speaking to his children)

noun
  1. (diminutive) mommy (used by children to mother)
  2. (diminutive) wifey (used by husband to wife)
  3. (diminutive) relatively older woman (by younger speaker to show friendly respect but less common in this sense than łá’ȕ)

particle
  1. placename for a place where a buffalo turned into stone in ancient times about 0.5 miles east of Taos

noun
  1. Wheeler Peak, Taos Peak (highest point in New Mexico)

noun
  1. wife's elder brother (elder brother-in-law related to wife), younger sister's husband (brother-in-law from younger sister's marriage)

particle
  1. Sandia Pueblo (folk etymological meaning: “place of the cloud hills”, a reference to the sand dunes in the area)

noun
  1. daughter, daughter-in-law
  2. any female child or younger female person

noun
  1. tale, story, "dump-telling" (translated thus because the dead were buried in dumps, i.e. refuse mounds in early times)

noun
  1. elder brother, elder brother-in-law, elder half-brother, elder stepbrother
  2. friendly greeting to a man of same or greater age of speaker (mostly used by male speakers)

noun
  1. (with local place prefix) bed
  2. (without local place prefix) mattress, sleeping mat

noun
  1. younger brother, younger brother-in-law, half-brother, stepbrother
  2. friendly greeting to younger male

noun
  1. water
  2. drop of water; river, stream, body of water

num
  1. hundred (only in combination with single digit numbers beside "one"; "one hundred" is formed differently as tę̋tę̌)

adv
  1. (religion) at Big House (the home of the lachina, which is under Blue Lake)

noun
  1. father (by child to father)
  2. husband (by wife to husband)
  3. relatively older man (by younger speaker showing friendly respect)

name
  1. a being in a traditional tale; the name is translated as "Seed-Marked Boy" by Trager, as "Printed-Red Boy, Spotted Corn Boy" by Parsons

noun
  1. father (by child to father)
  2. husband (by wife to husband)
  3. relatively older man (by younger speaker showing friendly respect)

noun
  1. (diminutive) daddy (used by children to father)
  2. (diminutive) hubby (used by wife to husband)

noun
  1. father, father-in-law
  2. husband (used by mother to refer husband when speaking to her children)

particle
  1. direction of the mountain Taos Peak (which is in the northeast)
  2. east (true east)

particle
  1. to the village, toward the village, Taos pueblo

particle
  1. in the village, at the village, Taos pueblo

noun
  1. people, person, human being, American Indian, Taos Indians

particle
  1. Picuris Pueblo; literally, "at the pass", referring to location of the pueblo near the west end of a pass leading to the Great Plains

verb
  1. sing, make a song, make a singing

noun
  1. (ceremonial) Taos people (literally: "Red Willows Canyon People", "Canyon of the Red Willows People")

noun
  1. metate bundle
  2. Metate Bundle (a being in a traditional tale)

noun
  1. In singular: rubber (object); in duoplural: rubber (the substance), rubber (objects)

noun
  1. mommy (used by children to mother)
  2. wifey (used by husband to wife)
  3. maternal aunt (by younger niece to aunt)
  4. relatively older woman (very commonly used by younger speaker to show friendly respect)

noun
  1. maternal grandmother (mother's mother), maternal great-grandmother (mother's father's mother or mother's mother's mother)
  2. older woman (used by younger speaker to any older woman in friendly respect)

noun
  1. son
  2. child
  3. son-in-law
  4. offspring
  5. any male child or younger male person
  6. children
  7. family (children, wife, and other household members)
  8. (in compounds) little one (has the content of a diminutive or affection)

noun
  1. sons, children, sons-in-law
  2. offspring
  3. any male children or younger male persons
  4. little ones (has the content of a diminutive or affection in compounds)
  5. family (children, wife, and other household members)
